# Test the size parsing function
result = hf.parse_download_size(''100MB'')
print(f''Parsed 100MB as: {result} bytes'')
print(f''That is: {result / (1024*1024)} MB'')
")

Bash(PYTHONPATH=. python -c "
import geoextent.lib.handleCSV as handleCSV
import csv

# Test just the header detection
with open(''/tmp/mc_registry_v6.csv'') as f:
    delimiter = '',''  # We know it''s comma-delimited
    data = csv.reader(f, delimiter=delimiter)
    header = next(data)
    print(''Header:'', header)

# Test geometry column detection
import re
search_geometry = [''(.)*geometry(.)*'', ''(.)*geom(.)*'', ''^wkt'', ''wkt$'', ''(.)*wkt(.)*'']
for idx, col_name in enumerate(header):
    for pattern in search_geometry:
        p = re.compile(pattern, re.IGNORECASE)
        if p.search(col_name) is not None:
            print(f''Found geometry column at index {idx}: {col_name}'')
            break
")

import geoextent.lib.handleCSV as handleCSV

print(''Geometry extraction result:'', result)
")

Bash(PYTHONPATH=. python -c "
import geoextent.lib.handleCSV as handleCSV
import geoextent.lib.helpfunctions as hf
import csv

with open(''/tmp/mc_registry_v6.csv'') as f:
    delimiter = '',''
    data = csv.reader(f, delimiter=delimiter)
    header = next(data)
    
search = {''geometry'': [''(.)*geometry(.)*'', ''(.)*geom(.)*'', ''^wkt'', ''wkt$'', ''(.)*wkt(.)*'']}

print(''Header:'', header)
print(''Testing searchForParameters...'')
geometry_columns = hf.searchForParameters([header], search[''geometry''], exp_data=''string'')
print(''geometry_columns result:'', geometry_columns)
")

Bash(PYTHONPATH=. python -c "
import geoextent.lib.handleCSV as handleCSV
result = handleCSV.getBoundingBox(''/tmp/mc_registry_v6.csv'')
print(''Full getBoundingBox result:'', result)
")
